trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell is currently available in two releases - 1.0 and 0.9.8.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell is currently available in two releases - 1.0 and 0.9.8.

trans-unit.source: If you have existing scripts and do not want to change them right now, you can continue using the 0.9.8 release.
trans-unit.target: If you have existing scripts and do not want to change them right now, you can continue using the 0.9.8 release.

trans-unit.source: When using the 1.0 release, you should carefully test your scripts in pre-production environments before using them in production to avoid unexpected impacts.
trans-unit.target: When using the 1.0 release, you should carefully test your scripts in pre-production environments before using them in production to avoid unexpected impacts.

trans-unit.source: 1.0 cmdlets follow the naming pattern {verb}-AzureRm{noun}; whereas, the 0.9.8 names do not include **Rm** (for example, New-AzureRmResourceGroup instead of New-AzureResourceGroup).
trans-unit.target: 1.0 cmdlets follow the naming pattern {verb}-AzureRm{noun}; whereas, the 0.9.8 names do not include **Rm** (for example, New-AzureRmResourceGroup instead of New-AzureResourceGroup).

trans-unit.source: When using Azure PowerShell 0.9.8, you must first enable the Resource Manager mode by running the **Switch-AzureMode AzureResourceManager** command.
trans-unit.target: When using Azure PowerShell 0.9.8, you must first enable the Resource Manager mode by running the **Switch-AzureMode AzureResourceManager** command.

trans-unit.source: This command is not necessary in 1.0.
trans-unit.target: This command is not necessary in 1.0.

trans-unit.source: New features will be added to only the 1.0 release.
trans-unit.target: New features will be added to only the 1.0 release.

trans-unit.source: For information about the 1.0 release, including how to install and uninstall the release, see [Azure PowerShell 1.0](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azps-1-0/).
trans-unit.target: For information about the 1.0 release, including how to install and uninstall the release, see [Azure PowerShell 1.0](https://azure.microsoft.com/blog/azps-1-0/).
